description_txt: stated on November 3, 2013 in comments on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "Health insurance is more expensive in Massachusetts than anywhere else in the country."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: "We’re one of the only communities in the country that didn’t lose population in the last census."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in a fundraising letter.:
quote_txt: "Providence has more of its pension fund invested in hedge funds and is less transparent" about it than the state.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 3, 2013

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in a flier:
quote_txt: Passage of a referendum on an aquarium for Clearwater means "NO future funding for our neighborhoods."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2013 in a flier:
quote_txt: "Natalyn Archibong skipped (Atlanta) City Council meetings or was late 90% of the time. Then she voted herself a pay raise."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2013 in comments on her TV show:
quote_txt: "Rand Paul’s speech ... on 'Gattaca' was totally ripped off of Wikipedia."

description_txt: stated on November 28, 2013 in a column in the "Wall Street Journal":
quote_txt: "Even after Obamacare is fully implemented, there still will be tens of millions of people not covered."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2013 in a YouTube attack ad:
quote_txt: As CFO, Alex Sink oversaw "a $27 billion loss in the state's pension fund."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2013 in a town hall meeting in Hudson, N.H.:
quote_txt: Under President George W. Bush, "we added $4.9 trillion to the debt. Under President Obama … we’ve added $6.5 trillion to the debt."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2013 in a debate.:
quote_txt: Terry McAuliffe "wants to raise your taxes $1,700 to pay for his infinite promises."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2013 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: Ken Cuccinelli would "take money away from public schools to fund private schools."

description_txt: stated on September 24, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Wisconsin ranks No. 2 in economic growth", according to the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia.

description_txt: stated on October 2, 2013 in a House floor speech:
quote_txt: "West Linn has one of the highest per capita rates of home-based businesses in the United States."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2013 in an email blast:
quote_txt: "Texas Governor Rick Perry’s voter ID law is a blatant effort to defeat Wendy Davis by disenfranchising tens of thousands of women voters."

description_txt: stated on October 26, 2013 in a speech to the Florida Democratic Party:
quote_txt: "This is the year Florida becomes a majority minority state."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: Most voters prefer zombies to the current U.S. Congress.

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2013 in testimony before Congress:
quote_txt: "If I have affordable coverage in my workplace, I'm not eligible to go into the marketplace. ... It’s illegal."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2013 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "FACT: Nothing in #Obamacare forces people out of their health plans."

description_txt: stated on October 27, 2013 in an interview on "This Week":
quote_txt: Says Mike Enzi is "getting about 84 percent of his campaign funds from Washington-based PACs. That's more than any senator of either party."

name_txt: League of Women Voters of Florida
description_txt: stated on October 10, 2013 in a statement:
quote_txt: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security warned that the SAVE "database is not a foolproof means of verifying (citizenship on) the voter rolls."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2013 in a broadcast of the Charlie Sykes Show on WTMJ:
quote_txt: "The number of Americans who receive means-tested government benefits -- welfare -- now outnumbers those who are year-round full-time workers."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2013 in an opinion column:
quote_txt: "78702 is the second-most gentrified ZIP code in the entire country."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2013 in a posting on Twitter:
quote_txt: "Soldiers Donating to Tea Party Now Face Punishment Under the Uniform Code of Military Justice."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 30, 2013

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2013 in comments on MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: "The vast majority of people in this country are keeping their (health insurance) plan."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2013 in a Fox News interview:
quote_txt: "Hidden" in the healthcare.gov code is language that means users "waive any reasonable right to privacy of your personal information."

description_txt: stated on September 3, 2013 in a white paper on Proposition 6:
quote_txt: $6 billion water bond program voters passed in 2011 "has yet to be tapped."

description_txt: stated on October 27, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: In Massachusetts, "half of the primary care doctors are not accepting new patients."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2013 in a press conference at AutoNation in Fort Lauderdale:
quote_txt: "In 2011, texting surpassed alcohol as the leading contributing factor in teen driving deaths."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2013 in a town hall meeting:
quote_txt: "We have about six school districts that are in school 140 to 150 days this year."

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2013 in a public address:
quote_txt: Nearly 6 in 10 uninsured Americans "can get health insurance for what may be the equivalent of your cell phone bill."
